metadata.title: CVE-2022-32981 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.3 on powerpc32-bit platforms. There is a buffer overflow in ptrace PEEKUSER andPOKEUSER (aka PEEKUSR and POKEUSR) when accessing floating point registers.

criterions.comment: linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
